main event: Multiple observed sightings of a large, bright, and rapidly moving UFO over Indiana and Pennsylvania in 1959, with detailed descriptions of its shape, color, and behavior. Observations were made by credible witnesses including Air Force personnel and provided to Project Blue Book for investigation.
interesting points: The UFO was described as a 'ball of fire' and observed to be traveling at speeds of 2,000 to 3,000 miles per hour, making it unlikely that the sighting was merely a mirage.

The report includes testimonies from a credible witness, an Aircraft Mechanic & Crew Chief from the USAF, who estimated the object's speed to be 500 to 600 m.p.h. and the distance from the object to be 200 to 500 feet.

Pilots flying at 8,200 feet observed a brilliantly lighted solid object roughly 200 feet in diameter, emitting an intense light, flying silently, and at a tremendous speed greater than their aircraft.
The object was observed to have a very bright beam-like searchlight directed from its center towards the ground, and displayed intermittent flashing red and green lights in one corner.

The report includes detailed weather conditions at the time of the sightings, along with a comprehensive questionnaire capturing various aspects of the observation such as the position of the object, its movement, and its dimensions.
sighted object: large, bright, and rapidly moving UFO
witnesses: aircraft mechanic, crew chief, pilots, ground observers
photographs: no photographs, but detailed descriptions and testimonies
